comment: No doubt the hardest teacher I have ever taken in college. Her tests are ridiculously hard, no one passed them in our class. I got a 35 and a 40 on the first two. In the beginning of the semester we started out with 27 people in the class. About 8 people were left by the end of the semester. I do not recommend taking her.

I was terrfied that first week of her class but now it became my favorite class of the semester. Her class is heavily effort-based so if you just put in the work then you will pass. She is super good about replying to emails so that's the best way to reach her if you have questions. READ THE BOOK because there is a mini-quiz every class. Oh- CITE!
This class is so difficult and will make you HATE philosophy.

HARDEST CLASS EVER!!! Bedard is passionate about what she teaches, super nice, and a great instructor BUT philosophy and all the philosophers you have to learn about will make you want to pull your hair out!!! Take one of the two other general education classes to fill the requirement! Trust me DO NOT TAKE PHILOSOPHY, you will regret it!

Firstly, if you plan on taking at least three classes, DO NOT TAKE BEDARD. You will get buried. Second, Her tests are tough to where a 60 is considered good. And when you write the research paper, for the love of God, CITE EVERY SENTENCE; She WILL fail you. That said, she's fun and helpful, but she could be unforgiving â€” Take at own risk. Cheers!
Not an easy teacher, but ONE OF THE BEST. I loved her class! All these negative comments are just lazy students. She is honestly one of the teachers I have remembered for years!!!

I can't believe I'm reading all these negative comments. She's definitely not an easy teacher, but her class was one of my FAVORITE. I loved her Ways of Knowing class and although it's tough, it's only because she makes the students think for themselves. Everyone posting negative comments are just lazy. If you want to learn, take her class!!

It's really freaking hard. You can tell she is trying to be helpful, and she will go out of her way if you ask her, but if you have more than three classes, do not take this. Heavy course work. If you don't think like her it gets really confusing.

I absolutely hate this class more than anything. If you have a 15+ hour schedule, this class is not for you because it is a lot of work. It's a lot of effort and though she can be helpful, it's hard as heck to get through this class. It's very heavy in writing so if that turns you off, run away as fast you can.
Not an easy A class. It's a lot of work for an undergrad class.

She knows exactly what she is talking about. If you don't understand, just ask and she will make the concept clear to you. It's hard to fail this course but an A isn't easy either. Philosophy is difficult in general anyway.Be ready for readings and writing a bit. If you pay attention and ask for help when you need it you should get a good grade.

She's very helpful. Whole point of Philosophy is to ask questions, so asking her questions is a life saver. Ask what's on the test, she'll tell you. Tests are hard, but she allowed a cheat sheet for one of them. Gave out 3 extra credit opportunities. take her if you want to learn something interesting, but not if you're trying to get an easy A

Philosophy is a hard subject in general. She does the best she can trying to explain it in a way for her student to understand. No matter how hard it is, it's pretty much impossible to fail IF YOU ASK QUESTIONS AND GO TO HER OFFICE TO GET HELP!
